info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 5:31PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...AN AREA OF MODERATE SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN BUTTE...NORTHWESTERN BONNEVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN BINGHAM COUNTIES... At 529 PM MST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Roberts to near Southeast Inl to 13 miles northeast of Arco. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... Atomic City, Central INL, Southeast INL, Southwest INL, Kettle Butte, East Butte and Big Southern Butte. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one half inch per hour in this area of moderate snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of heavy snow. Visibilities as low as one half of a mile in this area of moderate snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
